sentences.english: Seeds are open - minded, drink a heaven-sent "holy water."
sentences.chinese: 種子們放開胸懷，暢飲着天賜的“聖水”。

sentences.english: I feel like I'm god's gift to the world.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我就是上天賜給人間的禮物。

sentences.english: Carlin's book came as a godsend to the 72-year-old actor.
sentences.chinese: 對於這位72歲的演員，卡林的書不啻是個天賜良機。

sentences.english: She is the Heaven-sent angel you met.
sentences.chinese: 你見過她就知道她是天賜的天使。

sentences.english: Cool summer nights are more than just a heaven-sent oasis from the scorching day.
sentences.chinese: 涼爽的夏夜不但是來自炙熱白天天賜的綠洲。

sentences.english: In this sense, the novel can be regarded as an invisible writing of his initial experience of life.
sentences.chinese: 《牛天賜傳》是老舍生命初始經驗的隱形書寫。

sentences.english: This time the opportunity presented what he fatuously termed to himself 'cinch.
sentences.chinese: 他把這一次機會愚蠢地自稱爲“天賜良機”。

sentences.english: Beijing is an international city and deserves the great honor that was bestowed on it.
sentences.chinese: 北京是一座國際大都市，不愧其天賜的偉大榮耀。

sentences.english: To the Yogi everything is bliss.
sentences.chinese: 對於瑜伽修煉者，一切都是天賜之福。

sentences.english: And just to be clear, there is no such thing as a non-gifted believer.
sentences.chinese: 先說清楚，沒有無天賜的信徒。

sentences.english: That our love is just heaven-sent.
Tse to see han thin film turned away, hold Korea thin film strong lips.
sentences.chinese: 謝天賜眼看韓疏影轉身離去，抱住韓疏影強吻。

sentences.english: All things considered, however, she believes polymer clay has been a godsend.
sentences.chinese: 希曼說，她認爲軟陶就是天賜之物。

sentences.english: For Barack Obama, these signs of Republican softening are a godsend.
sentences.chinese: 對於奧巴馬來說，共和黨態度軟化的跡象乃天賜良機。

sentences.english: Xu Dajiang grows lawsuit the son to beat dead and bore witness god-given escape from prison.
sentences.chinese: 徐大強將獄長兒子打死並帶上了目擊者天賜越獄。

sentences.english: Health of body and mind is a great blessing, if we can bear it. John Henry Cardinal Newman.
sentences.chinese: 身體與頭腦的健康乃天賜之福，如果我們能承受的話。

definition: Wanli township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
to maintain good health/to raise a child or animal/curing (of concrete etc)
to waste (one's breath, one's energy etc)/to try in vain
alternative name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
